column4: Are you sure you aren't receiving many copies of the same email, and the deletion has nothing to do with the new arrival?  (Sorry, it's the best I can come up with.)
I don't think it's a NEW email, I think it's the old email due to the time stamps being the same.
How are you deleting, then?
I select them and hit delete, or I right click them and select delete message - both do the same thing.
Have you always had this problem with deletions, or is it new?
new, because I moved from thunderbird to evolution.
Do you have "view deleted messages" selected or not?
where at, under "view" itself in the top of the menu?
yes, there.
In the meantime, what version of evo?
2.30 I believe. its with 10.10
ok, I'm on 2.28 (10.4).  I like where hesham is going, but I can't find that setting on mine yet....
Do you have any filters defined?
nothing I set up separately.
careful -- pop has a subset of the features of imap.  You might be disappointed.
I really dont see what "features" I would be missing out on. I just want my email to send/receive/delete :P
:-)  Got it.
Which provider?
comcast is my ISP, gmail is the email I'm using.
(Sorry for following -- not a gmail user) So you're using IMAP to gmail, which is fetching mail from comcast?  Rather than accessing comcast imap directly?
iirc, IMAP pulls down headers without needing to pull down mail body.  With POP it's all or nothing.
aha!
whats the downside of "all or nothing?"
main downside is bandwidth.  If you've got lots, no downside.  I still live in a 2400 baud world in my tiny little brain, sometimes.
